title: Want more Fortnite content? Turn on 2FA for a free emote
description:
![fortnite](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Fortnite’s popularity has made it a top target for cybercriminals looking to
make a quick buck. In an effort to improve the security of its users, Epic
Games is offering a free emote to every player that turns on two-factor
authentication, which is win-win as far as we’re concerned.**

Two factor authentication most commonly takes the form of a six-digit code
which is emailed or texted to you when you want to log into an online account.
It essentially means that only someone with access to your phone on email can
sign into your account; just having your username and password isn’t enough.

**Related:[Internet security
guide](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/internet-security-privacy-
guide-3465790)**

2FA works. Earlier this year Google reported that it made it compulsory for
every one of its 85,000 employees and has seen incidents of successful
phishing attacks [reduced to near
zero](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2018/07/google-security-keys-neutralized-
employee-phishing/).

So enabling it was already a no-brainer if you want to keep your Epic Games
account secure from hackers, and now you get a free emote as an extra bonus.

## How to enable two-factor authentication in Fortnite

If you want to get the charming emote, then it’s a fairly simple process to
enable two-factor authentication on your account.

  1. Epic Games accounts support two different kinds of two-factor authentication; authenticator apps and emails. We’re going to use an authenticator app because it’s more secure than email, and will also work if you don’t have an active internet connection.
  2. First, download the authenticator app from your relevant app store. We like Duo, but Google Authenticator is also a great option.
  3. With the app downloaded, head to the [‘Password & Security’ tab](http://epicgames.com/2FA) of your Epic Games account.
  4. Scroll down to the ‘Two-Factor Authentication’ section, and click ‘Enable Authenticator App’.
  5. You’ll be shown a QR code on the screen. Open up your authenticator app on your phone and click the plus symbol to add a new account. This will open up your phone’s camera, which you can then use to scan the QR code on your computer screen.
  6. Now, enter the six-digit code that your app generates onto your online account on your computer.
  7. That’s it! You’ve now enabled 2FA on your Epic Games account, and you can now enjoy your free emote.
